item.title: 25 New Faces of Independent Film | Filmmaker Magazine
item.description:
25 New Faces of Independent Film | Filmmaker Magazine

The summer used to be a slow period for independent film, so what better time to focus our readers' attention on the up-and-coming artists who'd be shaping the next generation? That's what we were thinking back in 1998, when we decided to devote our Summer issue to what has become our most celebrated feature of the year, the "25 New Faces of Independent Film."

item.title: Quentin Tarantino | The Talks
item.description:
Quentin Tarantino | The Talks

I'm not shying away from that. If you think about the directors that have been accused of being foot-crazy, it would have been Alfred Hitchcock, it would have been Bu√±uel, Samuel Fuller - it's pretty good company. And it suggests they were pretty good filmmakers because they knew where to put their camera.
